title: EnglishPod 初级 英文播客 0071

segments.en: Hello, English learners.
Welcome back.
We are here at EnglishPod.
I am joined with Erica.
And my partner in crime, Marco.
Alright, so today we're going to be talking about a really great topic, one of my favorites.
segments.cn: 好的，今天我们要谈论一个非常好的话题，我最喜欢的之一。

segments.en: Beer.
Beer.
So, beer is a very popular drink, especially in bars and when you go out.
segments.cn: 所以，啤酒是一种非常受欢迎的饮料，尤其是在酒吧和外出时。

segments.en: Yes, it's very common with students, I think.
segments.cn: 是的，我认为学生中很常见。

segments.en: Yes.
And it's also not very strong like vodka or whiskey.
segments.cn: 而且它也不像伏特加或威士忌那么烈。

segments.en: Yes.
Okay, so we are going to be at a bar today and we're going to be looking at some of this vocabulary that you would find.
segments.cn: 好的，今天我们将在酒吧，并将查看一些你会发现的词汇。

segments.en: Yes, I mean, you've got to know this beer vocabulary.
segments.cn: 是的，我是说，你必须知道这些啤酒词汇。

segments.en: Okay, so let's listen to our dialogue for the first time and then we'll come back and look at these words.
segments.cn: 好的，让我们第一次听我们的对话，然后再回来看看这些词。

segments.en: Hey man, what do you have on top?
Heineken and Budweiser.
We have a two for one happy hour special.
segments.cn: 我们有买一送一的快乐时光特价。

segments.en: Cool.
Give me a pint of Heineken and half a pint of Bud.
segments.cn: 给我一品脱喜力和半品脱百威。

segments.en: Okay.
Pint of Heineken, half a pint of Bud for table six.
segments.cn: 一品脱喜力，半品脱百威，给六号桌。

segments.en: What about some appetizers?
Sure, let's have some nachos and mozzarella sticks.
segments.cn: 当然，来点玉米片和马苏里拉棒。

segments.en: Okay, that'll be 80 bucks.
What?
What?
Well, it's pretty expensive for two beers and some food.
segments.cn: 嗯，这对两杯啤酒和一些食物来说挺贵的。

segments.en: Yes.
Well, it happens sometimes you go to these very exclusive bars and they charge you like if it was gold.
segments.cn: 嗯，有时你去这些非常高档的酒吧，他们会像收黄金一样收费。

segments.en: I mean, that's crazy.
Well, let's take a look at some of these great words that we saw in language takeaway.
segments.cn: 好吧，让我们看看我们在语言外卖中看到的一些好词。

segments.en: Language takeaway.
Our first word is on tap.
segments.cn: 我们的第一个词是“在酒桶上”。

segments.en: On tap.
On tap.
So he asked, what do you have on tap?
segments.cn: 所以他问，你们有什么酒桶上的？

segments.en: Now, this is a strange sentence.
segments.cn: 现在，这是一个奇怪的句子。

segments.en: What exactly does it mean?
Okay, well, he's asking about what beers the bar has.
segments.cn: 好吧，他在问酒吧有什么啤酒。

segments.en: But not in a bottle or not in a can, right?
segments.cn: 但不是瓶装的或罐装的，对吧？

segments.en: Right.
So, you know, in a bar, there's often this machine, right?
segments.cn: 所以，你知道，在酒吧里，通常有这种机器，对吧？

segments.en: That will pour very fresh beer right directly into the glass.
segments.cn: 它会直接将非常新鲜的啤酒倒入杯中。

segments.en: Into the glass.
Yeah, this is a very popular thing because like you say, it's fresh beer.
segments.cn: 是的，这是一种非常受欢迎的方式，因为正如你所说，这是新鲜的啤酒。

segments.en: Yeah, it tastes better.
Tastes better.
Yeah.
Okay, so what do you have on tap?
segments.cn: 好的，你们有什么酒桶上的？

segments.en: What do you have on tap?
All right, let's take a look at our second word.
segments.cn: 好吧，让我们看看我们的第二个词。

segments.en: Happy hour.
Happy hour.
Happy hour.
Happy hour.
Now, this is very common and popular with bars.
segments.cn: 现在，这在酒吧中非常常见和受欢迎。

segments.en: Yes.
What is it when they have a happy hour?
Okay, a happy hour is a period of time where the drinks are very cheap.
segments.cn: 好吧，快乐时光是饮料非常便宜的一段时间。

segments.en: Okay, so happy hour could be from 5 P.M.
segments.cn: 好的，所以快乐时光可能是从下午5点

segments.en: till 10 P.M.
50% off.
So if the drink is $4, then it is now $2 in happy hour.
segments.cn: 所以如果饮料是4美元，那么在快乐时光就是2美元。

segments.en: Perfect.
And this brings us to our third word.
segments.cn: 这引出了我们的第三个词。

segments.en: A special.
A special.
A special.
A special.
So this is a noun and what does it mean when a restaurant or a bar has a special?
segments.cn: 这是一个名词，当餐厅或酒吧有特价时是什么意思？

segments.en: It's like they're having a sale.
A sale.
So things are cheaper.
So it could be, for example, a Monday night special.
segments.cn: 所以它可以是，例如，周一晚上的特价。

segments.en: Mm-hmm.
Or like in the dialogue, a happy hour special.
segments.cn: 或者像对话中提到的快乐时光特价。

segments.en: Okay, so it is a promotion.
segments.cn: 好的，所以这是一个促销。

segments.en: Yes.
All right, very good.
And now they ordered a pint of Heineken and half a pint of Budweiser.
segments.cn: 现在他们点了一品脱喜力和半品脱百威。

segments.en: Mm-hmm.
Pint.
This is a very, very special beer word.
segments.cn: 这是一个非常特别的啤酒词。

segments.en: So a pint is the size of your glass.
segments.cn: 所以一品脱是你杯子的大小。

segments.en: Okay, so we understand how much a pint is.
segments.cn: 好的，所以我们知道一品脱是多少。

segments.en: What would be the equivalent in liters?
A pint is 0.4 liters.
Okay, so almost half a liter is one pint.
segments.cn: 好的，所以一品脱几乎是半升。

segments.en: Yes.
Okay, it is very common when you go into a bar you can order a pint of beer.
segments.cn: 好的，进入酒吧时你可以点一品脱啤酒是很常见的。

segments.en: Yes, exactly.
In English we don't say I'll have half a liter of beer.
segments.cn: 在英语中我们不会说我要半升啤酒。

segments.en: Right, right.
So let's take a look at our next word on language takeaway.
segments.cn: 所以让我们看看语言外卖中的下一个词。

segments.en: Appetizers.
Appetizers.
Appetizers.
Appetizers.
Okay, so what is an appetizer?
Well, it is food you eat before your dinner or before your lunch.
segments.cn: 嗯，是你在晚餐或午餐前吃的食物。

segments.en: Okay, so it's usually maybe like a salad.
Or a soup or something small that you can eat right before your big meal.
segments.cn: 或者汤，或者一些你可以在大餐前吃的小东西。

segments.en: Okay, so some common appetizers at a bar and we saw them in our dialogue.
segments.cn: 好的，一些常见的酒吧开胃菜，我们在对话中看到过。

segments.en: Nachos and mozzarella sticks.
segments.cn: 玉米片和马苏里拉奶酪条。

segments.en: Nachos.
Nachos.
Nachos.
So nachos are little chips, right?
segments.cn: 所以玉米片是小脆片，对吧？

segments.en: Yeah, corn chips.
And it has cheese and maybe some tomatoes and maybe some beans.
segments.cn: 上面有奶酪，也许还有一些西红柿和豆子。

segments.en: Okay, so those are nachos.
They're very common in the United States.
Yes.
And what about mozzarella sticks?
Mozzarella sticks.
A travesty on the world and humanity and everyone's arteries.
segments.cn: 对世界和人类以及每个人的动脉的亵渎。

segments.en: Well, mozzarella is a cheese, right?
segments.cn: 嗯，马苏里拉是一种奶酪，对吧？

segments.en: Mm-hmm.
Mozzarella cheese.
And this cheese is, what is it, how is it prepared?
You put it in some bread crumbs and then you fry it in oil.
segments.cn: 你把它放在面包屑里，然后在油中炸。

segments.en: You deep fry it.
Uh-huh.
And you don't like this?
No, this is terrible.
Why?
They're so good.
Oh my god.
Because then you can dip it in a little sauce.
segments.cn: 因为你可以把它蘸一点酱。

segments.en: Oh, Marco, there are so many reasons why this is wrong.
segments.cn: 哦，马尔科，有很多理由说明这是错的。

segments.en: All right, well, mozzarella sticks.
A very popular bar food.
segments.cn: 一种非常受欢迎的酒吧食物。

segments.en: All right, well why don't we listen to the dialogue again and we'll be able to hear these words in context at a slower speed.
segments.cn: 好吧，为什么我们不再听一次对话，我们可以在慢速下听到这些词的上下文。

segments.en: Hey man, what do you have on top?
Heineken and Budweiser.
We have a two-for-one happy hour special.
segments.cn: 我们有买一送一的快乐时光特价。

segments.en: Cool.
Give me a pint of Heineken and half a pint of Bud.
segments.cn: 给我一品脱喜力和半品脱百威。

segments.en: Okay.
Pint of Heineken, half a pint of Bud for table six.
segments.cn: 一品脱喜力，半品脱百威，给六号桌。

segments.en: What about some appetizers?
Sure, let's have some, uh, let's have some nachos and mozzarella sticks.
segments.cn: 当然，来点，呃，来点玉米片和马苏里拉奶酪条。

segments.en: Okay, that'll be 80 bucks.
Wha, what?
Okay, so we saw some really good vocabulary words there and now let's take a look at putting it together.
segments.cn: 好的，我们看到了一些非常好的词汇，现在让我们看看如何把它们结合起来。

segments.en: Putting it together.
Well, in this one phrase that sometimes causes problems.
segments.cn: 嗯，这个短语有时会造成问题。

segments.en: So let's listen to this phrase that we're talking about.
segments.cn: 所以让我们听听我们所说的这个短语。

segments.en: What about some appetizers?
What about some appetizers?
Okay, so this phrase, what about?
Yeah, I often hear people use it to ask a question.
segments.cn: 是的，我经常听到人们用它来问问题。

segments.en: So a common mistake is asking, what about your weekend?
segments.cn: 所以一个常见的错误是问，周末怎么样？

segments.en: What about your new job?
Now this is incorrect, right?
You cannot use the phrase what about to ask a question about information.
segments.cn: 你不能用“怎么样”这个短语来询问信息。

segments.en: So you cannot ask for information.
Okay, because in our dialogue, the bartender said, and what about some appetizers?
segments.cn: 好的，因为在我们的对话中，酒保说，来点开胃菜怎么样？

segments.en: Right, because he is making a suggestion.
Right, so he's saying, well, why don't you have some some food?
segments.cn: 对，所以他说，嗯，为什么不来点食物呢？

segments.en: Yes, the phrase what about can be used to make a suggestion?
segments.cn: 是的，“怎么样”这个短语可以用来提出建议？

segments.en: Okay, so I can say, what about going to the movies?
segments.cn: 好的，所以我可以说，去看电影怎么样？

segments.en: You know what, let's hear a few more examples of this because I think it's really useful.
segments.cn: 你知道吗，让我们再听几个例子，因为我觉得这真的很有用。

segments.en: Example one.
What about these dirty clothes?
You said you would wash them days ago.
segments.cn: 你说你几天前会洗它们。

segments.en: Example two.
What about going to the mall instead?
I'm tired of going to the movies.
Example three.
What about a pizza instead of noodles?
segments.cn: 吃比萨饼而不是面条怎么样？

segments.en: All right, so really good examples and the same thing we can apply to how about.
segments.cn: 好的，所以真的很好的例子，同样的事情我们可以应用于“如何”。

segments.en: Exactly, so again, how about cannot ask for information.
segments.cn: 正是如此，所以再次强调，“如何”不能询问信息。

segments.en: Okay, so you can't say how about your boss.
segments.cn: 好的，所以你不能说“你老板怎么样”。

segments.en: All right, perfect.
Okay, so let's listen to this dialogue one last time and then we'll come back and talk a little bit more about bars and beers.
segments.cn: 好的，所以让我们最后再听一次这个对话，然后我们再回来谈谈酒吧和啤酒。

segments.en: Hey man, what do you have on top?
Heineken and Budweiser.
We have a two for one happy hour special.
segments.cn: 我们有买一送一的快乐时光特价。

segments.en: Cool, give me a pint of Heineken and half a pint of Bud.
segments.cn: 酷，给我一品脱喜力和半品脱百威。

segments.en: Okay, pint of Heineken, half a pint of Bud for table six.
segments.cn: 好的，一品脱喜力，半品脱百威，给六号桌。

segments.en: What about some appetizers?
Sure, let's have some, uh, let's have some nachos and mozzarella sticks.
segments.cn: 当然，来点，呃，来点玉米片和马苏里拉奶酪条。

segments.en: Okay, that'll be 80 bucks.
What?
Well, Marco, I know you're a big fan of beer and actually I think everyone here at Praxis is a big beer drinker.
segments.cn: 好吧，马尔科，我知道你是个啤酒爱好者，实际上我觉得这里的每个人都是个大啤酒饮用者。

segments.en: And this is the perfect opportunity to tell everyone about the world-renowned beer shake.
segments.cn: 这是告诉大家世界著名的啤酒奶昔的绝佳机会。

segments.en: Oh my gosh, uh, okay Marco.
segments.cn: 哦，我的天，呃，好吧马尔科。

segments.en: All right, so everyone that listens to this recipe is a non-believer.
segments.cn: 好吧，所有听这个食谱的人都是不信者。

segments.en: They say that it is not possible for it to taste good.
Okay.
But here's the recipe.
You take a liter of beer, or maybe half a liter.
segments.cn: 你拿一升啤酒，或者半升。

segments.en: So a pint?
A pint or a pint and a half.
And you put it in the blender.
Okay.
All right, now you take two eggs.
Uh-huh.
Okay, not cooked, not boiled, anything.
segments.cn: 好的，生的，不煮的，什么都可以。

segments.en: You take two eggs and put them in the blender.
segments.cn: 你拿两个鸡蛋放进搅拌机。

segments.en: It could be one or two.
Okay.
And then you take about half a cup of sugar, put it in the blender.
segments.cn: 然后你拿大约半杯糖，放进搅拌机。

segments.en: What?
And you mix all that together and you get this really good, foamy, delicious beer shake.
segments.cn: 然后把所有东西混合在一起，你会得到一种非常好、泡沫丰富、美味的啤酒奶昔。

segments.en: So a beer milkshake.
Well, it has no milk.
Okay.
But it's actually really good.
I've prepared it for some people.
They're like, no, that's not possible.
It can't taste good.
And in the end, they're like, wow, this is actually pretty good.
segments.cn: 最后，他们说，哇，这实际上挺好。

segments.en: So did you invent this recipe?
segments.cn: 所以你发明了这个食谱吗？

segments.en: It's actually really common in Ecuador, in Peru.
segments.cn: 其实在厄瓜多尔、秘鲁很常见。

segments.en: I've even seen it in Chile, usually with a dark beer.
segments.cn: 我甚至在智利见过，通常用深色啤酒。

segments.en: Okay.
Right?
So like a Guinness or... It could be a Guinness or... Yeah, if it's that, a dark beer is a little bit sweeter, so you wouldn't add so much sugar.
segments.cn: 所以像是吉尼斯或者……可以是吉尼斯或者……是的，如果是那种，深色啤酒稍微甜一点，所以你不需要加太多糖。

segments.en: But if you have another beer like a lager or a stout, you could still do it, but just add a little bit more sugar because that beer is a little bit more bitter.
segments.cn: 但如果你有其他啤酒，比如拉格或世涛，你仍然可以做，但只需多加一点糖，因为那种啤酒稍微苦一点。

segments.en: Okay.
Well, I am not going to try this recipe, but maybe you guys are.
segments.cn: 嗯，我不会尝试这个食谱，但也许你们会。

segments.en: You should try it out and let me know how it works.
segments.cn: 你们应该试试，然后告诉我效果如何。

segments.en: Yeah, you can tell us all about it on our website, EnglishPod.com.
segments.cn: 是的，你可以在我们的网站 EnglishPod.com 上告诉我们所有关于它的事。

segments.en: Yeah, and we're definitely there to answer all your questions.
segments.cn: 是的，我们肯定会在那儿回答你所有的问题。

segments.en: And I'll be posting the recipe as well on the website.
segments.cn: 我也会在网站上发布这个食谱。

segments.en: All right.
Well, we're out of time for today, but thanks for listening.
segments.cn: 嗯，我们今天的时间到了，但谢谢你的收听。

segments.en: And until next time, bye.
